13#define GENERAL_REGISTERS(V) \
14 V(rax) \
15 V(rcx) \
16 V(rdx) \
17 V(rbx) \
18 V(rsp) \
19 V(rbp) \
20 V(rsi) \
21 V(rdi) \
22 V(r8) \
23 V(r9) \
24 V(r10) \
25 V(r11) \
26 V(r12) \
27 V(r13) \
28 V(r14) \
29 V(r15)
30
31#define ALWAYS_ALLOCATABLE_GENERAL_REGISTERS(V) \
32 V(rax) \
33 V(rbx) \
34 V(rdx) \
35 V(rcx) \
36 V(rsi) \
37 V(rdi) \
38 V(r8) \
39 V(r9) \
40 V(r11) \
41 V(r12) \
42 V(r15)
43
44#ifdef V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
45#define MAYBE_ALLOCATABLE_GENERAL_REGISTERS(V)
46#else
47#define MAYBE_ALLOCATABLE_GENERAL_REGISTERS(V) V(r14)
48#endif
49
50#define ALLOCATABLE_GENERAL_REGISTERS(V) \
51 ALWAYS_ALLOCATABLE_GENERAL_REGISTERS(V) \
52 MAYBE_ALLOCATABLE_GENERAL_REGISTERS(V)
53
54enum RegisterCode {
55#define REGISTER_CODE(R) kRegCode_##R,
56 GENERAL_REGISTERS(REGISTER_CODE)
57#undef REGISTER_CODE
58 kRegAfterLast
59};
60
61class Register : public RegisterBase<Register, kRegAfterLast> {
62 public:
63 constexpr bool is_byte_register() const { return code() <= 3; }
64 // Return the high bit of the register code as a 0 or 1. Used often
65 // when constructing the REX prefix byte.
66 constexpr int high_bit() const { return code() >> 3; }
67 // Return the 3 low bits of the register code. Used when encoding registers
68 // in modR/M, SIB, and opcode bytes.
69 constexpr int low_bits() const { return code() & 0x7; }
70
71 private:
72 friend class RegisterBase<Register, kRegAfterLast>;
73 explicit constexpr Register(int code) : RegisterBase(code) {}
74};
75
76// Register that store tagged value. Tagged value is in compressed form when
77// pointer compression is enabled.
78class TaggedRegister {
79 public:
80 explicit TaggedRegister(Register reg) : reg_(reg) {}
81 Register reg() { return reg_; }
82
83 private:
84 Register reg_;
85};
86
87ASSERT_TRIVIALLY_COPYABLE(Register);
88static_assert(sizeof(Register) <= sizeof(int),
89 "Register can efficiently be passed by value");
90
91// Assign |source| value to |no_reg| and return the |source|'s previous value.
92inline Register ReassignRegister(Register& source) {
93 Register result = source;
94 source = Register::no_reg();
95 return result;
96}
97
98#define DECLARE_REGISTER(R) \
99 constexpr Register R = Register::from_code(kRegCode_##R);
100GENERAL_REGISTERS(DECLARE_REGISTER)
101#undef DECLARE_REGISTER
102constexpr Register no_reg = Register::no_reg();
103
104constexpr int kNumRegs = 16;
105
106#ifdef V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
107// Windows calling convention
108constexpr Register kCArgRegs[] = {rcx, rdx, r8, r9};
109
110// The Windows 64 ABI always reserves spill slots on the stack for the four
111// register arguments even if the function takes fewer than four arguments.
112// These stack slots are sometimes called 'home space', sometimes 'shadow
113// store' in Microsoft documentation, see
114// https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/build/x64-calling-convention.
115constexpr int kWindowsHomeStackSlots = 4;
116#else
117// AMD64 calling convention
118constexpr Register kCArgRegs[] = {rdi, rsi, rdx, rcx, r8, r9};
119#endif // V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
120
121constexpr int kRegisterPassedArguments = arraysize(kCArgRegs);
122
123#define DOUBLE_REGISTERS(V) \
124 V(xmm0) \
125 V(xmm1) \
126 V(xmm2) \
127 V(xmm3) \

131 V(xmm7) \
132 V(xmm8) \
133 V(xmm9) \
134 V(xmm10) \
135 V(xmm11) \
136 V(xmm12) \
137 V(xmm13) \
138 V(xmm14) \
139 V(xmm15)

142#define SIMD128_REGISTERS DOUBLE_REGISTERS

166 V(ymm4) \
167 V(ymm5) \

171 V(ymm9) \

179// Returns the number of padding slots needed for stack pointer alignment.
180constexpr int ArgumentPaddingSlots(int argument_count) {
181 // No argument padding required.
182 return 0;
183}
184
185constexpr AliasingKind kFPAliasing = AliasingKind::kOverlap;
186constexpr bool kSimdMaskRegisters = false;
187
188enum DoubleRegisterCode {
189#define REGISTER_CODE(R) kDoubleCode_##R,
190 DOUBLE_REGISTERS(REGISTER_CODE)
191#undef REGISTER_CODE
192 kDoubleAfterLast
193};
194
195enum YMMRegisterCode {
196#define REGISTER_CODE(R) kYMMCode_##R,
197 YMM_REGISTERS(REGISTER_CODE)
198#undef REGISTER_CODE
199 kYMMAfterLast
200};
201static_assert(static_cast<int>(kDoubleAfterLast) ==
202 static_cast<int>(kYMMAfterLast),
203 "The number of XMM register codes must match the number of YMM "
204 "register codes");
205
206class XMMRegister : public RegisterBase<XMMRegister, kDoubleAfterLast> {
207 public:
208 // Return the high bit of the register code as a 0 or 1. Used often
209 // when constructing the REX prefix byte.
210 int high_bit() const { return code() >> 3; }
211 // Return the 3 low bits of the register code. Used when encoding registers
212 // in modR/M, SIB, and opcode bytes.
213 int low_bits() const { return code() & 0x7; }
214
215 protected:
216 friend class RegisterBase<XMMRegister, kDoubleAfterLast>;
217 explicit constexpr XMMRegister(int code) : RegisterBase(code) {}
218};
219
220ASSERT_TRIVIALLY_COPYABLE(XMMRegister);
221static_assert(sizeof(XMMRegister) <= sizeof(int),
222 "XMMRegister can efficiently be passed by value");
223
224class YMMRegister : public XMMRegister {
225 public:
226 static constexpr YMMRegister from_code(int code) {
227 V8_ASSUME(code >= 0 && code < XMMRegister::kNumRegisters);
228 return YMMRegister(code);
229 }
230
231 static constexpr YMMRegister from_xmm(XMMRegister xmm) {
232 return YMMRegister(xmm.code());
233 }
234
235 private:
236 friend class XMMRegister;
237 explicit constexpr YMMRegister(int code) : XMMRegister(code) {}
238};
239
240ASSERT_TRIVIALLY_COPYABLE(YMMRegister);
241static_assert(sizeof(YMMRegister) <= sizeof(int),
242 "YMMRegister can efficiently be passed by value");
243
244using FloatRegister = XMMRegister;
245
246using DoubleRegister = XMMRegister;
247
248using Simd128Register = XMMRegister;
249
250using Simd256Register = YMMRegister;
251
252#define DECLARE_REGISTER(R) \
253 constexpr DoubleRegister R = DoubleRegister::from_code(kDoubleCode_##R);
254DOUBLE_REGISTERS(DECLARE_REGISTER)
255#undef DECLARE_REGISTER
256constexpr DoubleRegister no_dreg = DoubleRegister::no_reg();
257
258#define DECLARE_REGISTER(R) \
259 constexpr YMMRegister R = YMMRegister::from_code(kYMMCode_##R);
260YMM_REGISTERS(DECLARE_REGISTER)
261#undef DECLARE_REGISTER
262
263// Define {RegisterName} methods for the register types.
264DEFINE_REGISTER_NAMES(Register, GENERAL_REGISTERS)
265DEFINE_REGISTER_NAMES(XMMRegister, DOUBLE_REGISTERS)
266DEFINE_REGISTER_NAMES(YMMRegister, YMM_REGISTERS)

268// Give alias names to registers for calling conventions.
269constexpr Register kStackPointerRegister = rsp;
270constexpr Register kReturnRegister0 = rax;
271constexpr Register kReturnRegister1 = rdx;
272constexpr Register kReturnRegister2 = r8;
273constexpr Register kJSFunctionRegister = rdi;
274constexpr Register kContextRegister = rsi;
275constexpr Register kAllocateSizeRegister = rdx;
276constexpr Register kInterpreterAccumulatorRegister = rax;
277constexpr Register kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister = r9;
278constexpr Register kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister = r12;
279constexpr Register kInterpreterDispatchTableRegister = r15;
280
281constexpr Register kJavaScriptCallArgCountRegister = rax;
282constexpr Register kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister = rcx;
283constexpr Register kJavaScriptCallTargetRegister = kJSFunctionRegister;
284constexpr Register kJavaScriptCallNewTargetRegister = rdx;
285constexpr Register kJavaScriptCallExtraArg1Register = rbx;
286
287constexpr Register kRuntimeCallFunctionRegister = rbx;
288constexpr Register kRuntimeCallArgCountRegister = rax;
289constexpr Register kRuntimeCallArgvRegister = r15;
290// TODO(14499): Rename to kWasmInstanceDataRegister.
291constexpr Register kWasmInstanceRegister = rsi;
292constexpr Register kWasmTrapHandlerFaultAddressRegister = r10;
293
294// Default scratch register used by MacroAssembler (and other code that needs
295// a spare register). The register isn't callee save, and not used by the
296// function calling convention.
297constexpr Register kScratchRegister = r10;
298constexpr XMMRegister kScratchDoubleReg = xmm15;
299constexpr YMMRegister kScratchSimd256Reg = ymm15;
300constexpr Register kRootRegister = r13; // callee save
301#ifdef V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
302constexpr Register kPtrComprCageBaseRegister = r14; // callee save
303#else
304constexpr Register kPtrComprCageBaseRegister = no_reg;
305#endif
306
307constexpr DoubleRegister kFPReturnRegister0 = xmm0;
